item.title: LOG 3.6: Five Months
item.description: 8th April 2013 Hi! Yes, it’s been a long time. Nearly 5 months since I last wrote an update email. In November I went to Berlin for my UK visa, and spent whatever hours I was not at work or sleeping on writing a novel.

item.title: LOG 3.4: Munich
item.description: Hello, Happy Pillayaar Chathurthi (festival for Ganesha- the elephant headed god) to you and your families ðŸ™‚ I just got back from lunch with my Indian friends.

item.title: LOG 3.3: To love a guitar
item.description: 6th August, 2012 Hello! Hope you are doing well. I sang in the Vorspiel Abend (Performance evening) with my rapper friend, Sven. I was nervous but it went well.

item.title: LOG 3.2: Music in the Air
item.description: 14th July, 2012 Hello everyone! Every Friday since I last wrote to you I have been going to 22 Otto Suhr Strasse for making music with the band.

item.title: LOG 3.1: Summer Solstice
item.description: 21st June, 2012 Happy Summer Solstice everyone ðŸ™‚ It has been two weeks since I got back to Germany from India. All the trees grew back their leaves in the month I was gone so everything looks and feels alive!

item.title: LOG 2.7: Acapella Abend
item.description: 13th February, 2012 Hello, Europe is getting hit by a cold wave. Last two weeks were pretty severe in places like Ukraine, Poland etc. Oldenburg sunk below 0C and only today it has risen above to a measley 3.

item.title: LOG 2.6: Solistice
item.description: 23rd December, 2011 Hello ðŸ™‚ It is Winter here but there has been only scanty snowfall which secretly fell in the night and looked like frosty icing in the morning, quickly melting away.

item.title: LOG 2.5: Smooth
item.description: 28th November 2011 Hi! How are you all ðŸ™‚ Life cruises smoothly by. A bit too fast; weeks whizz by at an incredible pace. Work is moving smoothly, social life is fun and uncomplicated ðŸ™‚

item.title: LOG 2.4: Time of my life :)
item.description: Hello everyone, It has been an unreasonable amount of time since I last wrote. More than a month! And so many things can happen in a month.

item.title: Amma endrazhaikadha uyirillaye: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This is a beautiful song which is for mothers from their grateful children. In the movie the character portrayed by Rajani Kanth is taking care of his old mother.

item.title: LOG 1.21: Musik und Ordnung
item.description: 29th June, 2011 Hello everyone ðŸ™‚ I just scored 93% on my first level German exam! Feeling great about it! I have found order (ordunung) in my life and everything is organised in lists and inserted in my Google calendar and on my Napkin-mousepad ðŸ™‚ the furniture in my room is rearranged and everything is clean and tidy.

item.title: LOG 1.19: Sunsets
item.description: 2nd June, 2011 Hello, This will be a short one. MATLAB week is going surprisingly well and I’m learning a lot without getting frustrated. Only tomorrow left and I find that it has been an easier one than most others.

item.title: Benaam sa yeh dard: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: A translation after a long time! Here is a song from Jagjit Singh. Benaam sa yeh dard thahar kyon nahi jaata jo beet gaya hai vo

item.title: LOG 1.17: Oh wow, Barcelona!
item.description: 11th May, 2011 Ola everyone ðŸ™‚ I have successfully recovered to a state of normalcy after the most amazing and exhausting weekend I can ever remember having!

item.title: LOG 1.13: Spring 'time', German and the 60Â´s
item.description: 31st March, 2011 After some rain last night, the air smells like monsoon in India; so fresh and clean! IÂ´ve opened the window to let it come in and along with it are the chirps and tweets of the birds.

item.title: LOG 1.10: The first signs
item.description: 28th February, 2011 Hello, It is now possible to see the first signs of Spring. The trees are bearing buds that will leaf and flower forth.

item.title: LOG 1.9: Aerobics, Music, Star Trek
item.description: 17th February, 2011 Hello everyone, I just came back from an hour of the most exhausting exercise in probably Years! I never realised how out-of-shape I have been until I saw 60 odd other people able to jump around during what they call ‘Power Gym’ for an hour while I was out of breath within 15 minutes.

item.title: LOG 1.8: Missing English and The Tree of Gondor
item.description: 11th February, 2011 Hello all, I got a mobile and landline connection. From my home number I can call landlines all over europe for free! So if you are in Europe, let me know your number and we can have a little phone chat ðŸ™‚

item.description: Here is another Kamal song sung by SPB. This is from the movie Aboorva Sagotharargal where Kamal acts as brothers. One who looks normal and another who is very short.

item.title: Engeyum Eppothum (Ninaithale Inikkum) Lyrics and Translation
item.description: Here is a song with both Rajani and Kamal Hassan with Jayaprada. It is from a movie called Ninaithale Inikkum. Also from the 80Â´s. Thanks to my dad for corrections with the translation.

item.title: Vaasam Ella Malar Ithu
item.description: The nusic for this song was composed by T Rajendar and anthother person. It was their first movie, called Oru Thalai Raagam, meaning one sided raagam, implying unrequitted love.

item.description: One of my readers requested a translation of this. Makes me happy that she asked! **kaalamelaam kaadhal vaazhga kaadhalenum vaedham vaazhga kaadhalae nimmadhi kanavugalae adhan sannidhi

item.title: Annal Mele Panithuli
item.description: This soft and melodious song comes from the movie Varanam Aayiram. Surya, who has proved his talent several times before, does it again in this movie playing the role of the father and playing the son from his late teens into manhood.

item.title: Senthamizh Naatu Thamizhachiye: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: Here is a song from the movie Vandicholai Chinraasu. For the light comical tune it keeps, the last verse is incongruously preachy. It reflects the morals and values of the early 90s especially in smaller towns.

item.title: Satham Illatha Thanimai Kaetten
item.description: This song is from a movie called Amarkalam, starring Ajit and Shalini. The song is sung by SPB and supposed to have been breathless in the movie.

item.title: Kanmani Anbodu Kadhalan: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This is a song in which Kamal plays an illiterate man in love. He wanted to write a letter to his sweetheart and asks help to make it sound poetic.

item.title: Manaivi Amaivathellam: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This is a relatively old song sung by Yesudas. **manaivi amaivathellam iraivan kodutha varam manadhu mayangi yenna unakkum vaazhvu varum** A [good] woman who becomes your wife

item.title: Uyirum Niye Udalum Niye: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: I found this song unintentionally. It is composed by A.R. Rahman and sung by Unnikrishnan. **uyirum neeye udalum neeye uravum neeye thaaye(2)** You are life, you are the body,

item.title: Vidai Kodu Engal Nade: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This song is from Kannathil Muththam Ittal. It is a touching story about little girl who tries to find her biological mother after finding out she was adopted.

item.title: Nadiye Nadiye Kadhal Nadiye: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: The movie Rhythm has themed songs on the various elements of nature. This one is on water. The lyrics draw a comparisons between the qualities of women and and of water.

item.title: En Veetu Thotathil: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This sweet love song from the movie Gentleman in the 1990s is one of A.R. Rahman’s lesser known gems. It has a fresh, innocent, morning feel to it even though the lyrics are more explicit than many other Tamil songs of that time.

item.title: Enna Ithu: Feature Spoiler 'Nala Damayanthi '
item.description: If you are in love, you will love this song. The melody has a dreamy and floaty feeling to it and the lyrics describe the wonder and joy of being in love.

item.title: Written in the moonlight
item.description: From May 2008 For too long I have absorbed. Here in this moonlight. I still see colour. I breathe. I create. There is no romantic breeze

item.description: I actually feel bad translating this song because most of it is in Tamilised-English and can be understood by most Indians but there are some words and phrases left to explain.

item.title: Chopin's Nostalgia: Ballade No. 2 in F Major op. 38
item.description: Chopin has always been the most real sound track of my life. I got to know some of his most popular pieces as a nine year old in Australia when Reader’s Digest sent the CD for my mum.

item.title: LfE 8: Gifford Lectures and Indian Festivities
item.description: 23/10/2009 Greetings! I recover from a cough as I write this. The reason for the long silence is the fever I had last weekend. I know you kind-hearted people are starting to worry already!

item.title: Nila Kaigirathu â€“ Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This song has two versions. One sung by a little girl and the other by an adult male voice(Hariharan). It is melodious and beautiful. They have some variations in lyrics so I have chosen to translate the one by the child.

item.title: Kaadhalin Deepam â€“ Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This is a melodious potential Ohrwurm which describes how he is falling in love. As it seems to be typical of the time period in which this movie was made, the choreography is weird, their expressions seem more contemplative or sad than joyful and the costume design is odd but the song sounds good.

item.title: Pachai Niramae: Lyrics and Translation
item.description: The lyrics of this song uses vivid imagery of colours to describe love and the woman he is in love with. The song begins with him shouting out in joy that she smiled at him.

item.title: Yamunai Aatrile â€“ Lyrics and Translation

item.title: Uyire Uyire â€“ Lyrics and Translation
item.description: From the movie Bombay, this is another super-hit from Rahman. Hariharan’s voice makes it take on a etheral quality. And if I may say so, these lyrics far out-beat the Hindi remake.

item.title: Swasame â€“ Lyrics and Translation
item.description: From Thenali, another Kamal Movie (:)), this clip starts with her singing to him and he tells her that it would be better to sing a duet in their dreams (unobserved by street people) so they can change location and clothes as they please (as it typical of movie songs).

item.title: Vaseegara â€“ Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This song was a big hit when it first came out and still is very popular. It is from the movie Minnile which means lightning. It is considered a sensual song and therefore it must have some strange dance scenes in the middle to leave the real sensual things to imagination if you be so inclined.

item.title: Anthi Mazhai Lyrics and Translations
item.description: I think by now it is quite easy to tell I am a big fan of Kamal Hassan. His acting is so versatile, it truly is a pity that just because of the language and/or a cultural barrier, the rest of the world is missing out.

item.description: A.R. Rahman had another party with this movie. He has explored several new styles including hip pop in the movie Shivaji â€“ The Boss. Although it has some lines just for the sake of rhyming lyrics(I will mark these with a â€˜*â€™), this song makes me long for home.

item.title: Athisaya Raagam Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This raagam, called Mahati, has only 4 notes. In Karnatic music, all raagams have either 5, 6 or 7 notes. But Balamurali Krishna invented this one and was critisised for his non-traditional innovation.

item.title: Kanne Kalaimaane Lyrics and Translation
item.description: In this song, Kamalâ€™s character is singing to Srideviâ€™s character. The story of Moondraam Pirai is about a troubled young man who finds a mentally ill girl about to be sold for the first time in a brothal.

item.title: Thakita Thadimi (Salangai Oli) Lyrics Translated
item.description: I recommend this beautiful movie to everyone. In this song, the uber-talented dancer has become an alcoholic and he sings and dances referring to the past he shares with the widow who is watching him.

item.title: Ennavale Adi Ennavale Lyrics and Translation
item.description: Back to more recent times. I remember this and another song’s effects and graphics very well from when I watched the movie Kadhalan. Patta Rap, Mukkala Mukkabala and other songs from this movie also became very popular but this must be the most melodious of the collection.

item.title: Vinnodum Mugilodum Lyrics and Translation
item.description: If anyone were to remake this song with rock instruments, I think it would hit the rock charts world wide even if no one understood it.

item.title: Main Shaayar Toh Nahi Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This is one of the old goodies of Hindi music. It has a very simple structure but nice meanings. This time, the video is below the translation.

item.title: Malarnthum Malaraatha Lyrics and Translation
item.description: This song is a classic. It is from a movie called Paasa Malar (flower or affection). I grew up listening to lots of oldies and enjoyed their high lyricism.

item.title: Anbe Sivam Lyrics Translation
item.description: The movie this song is from is also called Anbe Sivam. It is one of Kamal HassanÂ´s most poignant movies and I recommend it to everyone if they can find it with subtitles.

item.title: Seasons Change Lyrics ; Bangs and Bags
item.description: Bangs and Bags go together. Women have fancied them so since the beginning of fashion history. They go together like carrots and peas, sweet and sour, beauty and the beast.
